Body: Possible Duplicate:  How do I upgrade Firmware on my Samsung Galaxy S without windows  Froyo has been finally released for Samsung Galaxy S. The update seems to be only available via a Windows application called Kies. I don't have access to a Windows computer any more (I use Mac and Linux systems only). Does anybody know how to install the update (the official one, not CyanogenMod) without this application? Can I use Custom Recovery for this like in this related answer?
Title: How to install the official Android 2.2 (froyo) on Samsung Galaxy S without Windows/Kies

history.Text: Froyo has been [finally released][1] for Samsung Galaxy S. The update seems to be only available via a Windows application called Kies. I don't have access to a Windows computer any more (I use Mac and Linux systems only). Does anybody know how to install the update (the official one, not CyanogenMod) without this application? Can I use Custom Recovery for this like in [this related answer][2]?  [1]: http://www.engadget.com/2010/10/15/galaxy-s-android-2-2-froyo-update-begins-to-trickle-out/  [2]: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/181/how-do-i-upgrade-firmware-on-my-samsung-galaxy-s-without-windows/1272#1272
How to install the official Android 2.2 (froyo) on Samsung Galaxy S without Windows/Kies
